summary: This bill, the Securing Infrastructure from Adversaries Act of 2025, prohibits the Secretary of Transportation from contracting with entities that use or procure light detection and ranging (LiDAR) technology from certain foreign entities or covered LiDAR companies, due to national security concerns. The bill defines prohibited technologies and provides waivers for activities deemed in the national interest. It also restricts the use of federal loan or grant funds for such technologies and sets an applicability date of June 30, 2026, with some limitations.
